description.narrative:
1. Expansion of tourism enabling infrastructure to frontier regions: The Project will add supply of quality hospitality infrastructure in the regions of El Nido and Benguet, frontier regions which are new tourism destinations and have a high potential for development. In 2015, the Philippines registered 5 million foreign visitors, this is expected to grow to 6 million in 2017-2018.
2. Employment generation: As the Company grows, the proposed project will create a significant number of employment opportunities for the local communities both during construction and operational phases; the company's strong training program offered to employees will contribute to the upskilling of the workforce and strengthen both hard and soft skills for hotel employees. The projects is also expected to generate significant indirect employment through its supply chain.
3. Benefits to the local economy and supply linkages: the Project will create demand for locally-sourced materials, services and labor both during the construction and operational phases. The company places an emphasis on local sourcing and the Project is expected to support local suppliers (many of them being SMEs) such as manufacturers of cement and other building materials, produce farmers, food processors, transportation companies, restauranteurs and arts and crafts manufacturers, promote their growth and help them professionalize through trainings.
